div.div: Meal pick-up available during school closure

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
p.span: The Lynden School District is committed to providing access to the nutrition students need during theextended school closure. Wewill be offering meals for pick up at four school sites:Fisher Elementary, Isom Elementary, BerniceVossbeckElementaryand Lynden Middle School. Meals will be free for all children0-18 years of age (they do not need to be a student). Mealpick-upservice is scheduled to beginThursday, March 19.

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
p.span: Childrenmust be presentto receive their meals

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
p.span: Meals areavailable for pick upMonday through Friday,from 11 am to12:30 pm. Meals are available for all children and can be picked up at any of the four locations

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
p.span: Breakfast for the next morning will be given out with lunch

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
p.span: Adult meals are not available for purchase

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
p.span: Food must be eaten off campus

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
p.span: We are currentlyexploring the possibility ofa meal delivery plan for families unable to make it to any of the locations. Wewill announce details as they become known.

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.strong: EFECTIVO a partir del 19 de marzo Respecto a los almuerzos durante el cierre escolar extendido.

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: justify;
p.span: El distrito escolar de Lynden se compromete a proveer a los alumnos la nutricin que necesitan durante el cierre extendido de las escuelas. Ofreceremos comidas que podrn buscar en cuatro escuelas: Fisher Elementary, Isom Elementary, BerniceVossbeckElementaryy Lynden Middle School. Las comidas sern gratuitas para todos los nios de hasta 18 aos de edad (no es necesario que sean alumnos). Este servicio estar disponible a partir del jueves 19 de marzo.

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: justify;

ul.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

li.span: Los nios deben estar presentes para recibir sus comidas.

Las comidas se podrn recolectar de lunes a viernes, desde las 11:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 p.m. Estarn disponibles para todos los nios y podrn recogerse en cualquiera de las cuatro ubicaciones mencionadas.
Se entregar un almuerzo y un desayuno para el da siguiente.
No se podrn comprar comidas para adultos.
La comida deber ser consumida fuera del campus.

p.style: caret-color: rgb(34, 34, 34); color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: justify;
p.span: Actualmente, estamos analizando la posibilidad de armar un plan para entregarle las comidas a aquellas familias que no puedan acercarse a ninguna de las ubicaciones mencionadas. Anunciaremos las noticias cuando lo sepamos con certeza.

div.div:
1203 Bradley Road, Lynden, WA 98264
Phone 360-354-4443 | Fax 360-354-7662

div.p: Lynden School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, marital status, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal, and provides equal access to all youth groups identified in U.S.C., Title 36. The District has designated the following employees to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights Compliance Coordinator Jim Frey (freyj@lynden.wednet.edu | 360-354-4443), and Title IX Officer and Section 504 Coordinator Tim Metz (metzt@lynden.wednet.edu | 360-354-2952). Address: 516 Main St., Lynden, WA 98264.
